Television|Warner Horizon Television]] | country = United States | distributor = [[MTV]] | followed_by = [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 4)|Season 4]] | preceded_by = [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 2)|Season 2]] | network = [[MTV]] (U.S.)
[[MuchMusic]] (Canada) }} The third season of ''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]'' premiered on January 15, 2009. It was hosted by [[Mario Lopez]] and featured [[Layla Kayleigh]] as the backstage correspondent. The judges included rapper [[Lil Mama]], former [['N Sync|*NSYNC]] singer [[JC Chasez]], and hip-hop choreographer [[Shane Sparks]]. Chasez, one of the three judges, said "we'll be taking a bit more time between seasons, which will give people ample time to get their crews together, practice and prepare." This was the first season without a special casting episode.{{cite web |url=http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2008/12/more-information-about-on-season-3.html |title=Straight Information about ABDC Season 3}} On March 5, 2009, [[Quest Crew]] was declared the winner of Season 3 and received the $100,000 ([[United States dollar|USD]]) prize.{{cite web |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2008/08/americas-best-1.html |title='America's Best Dance Crew' SoReal Cru vs. Super Cr3w |accessdate=2008-08-08 |date=2008-08-08 |work=LA Times |publisher=Jevon Phillips}} == Crews == Like [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 1)|season 1]], nine crews were selected in this season of ''America's Best Dance Crew'', as opposed to last season's ten crews. The nine crews were not divided into the usual four regions (East, West, Midwest, and South), but each crew's banner still listed where each crew was from.http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/01/15/video-fanny-paks-phil-collins-chats-up-shane-sparks-and-kid-rainen/ It was also the first season that showcased a crew from the [[Caribbean]]. Team Millennia, who was eliminated during the season 2 casting special, returned this season as one of the nine official dance crews.http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/01/08/abdc-season-3-find-out-which-crews-made-the-final-cut/ This season also has a heavy cross-over with ''[[So You Think You Can Dance (US)|So You Think You Can Dance]]''. Quest Crew's Ryan Conferido was a season 1 finalist, Hok and D-Trix (Dominic) were season 3 finalists. Also, [[clogging|clogger]] Brandon Norris of Dynamic Edition was heavily featured during the season 3 try-outs of ''SYTYCD'' and performed at the season finale. Judge [[Shane Sparks]] has also judged and choreographed for numerous seasons of ''SYTYCD''. Also included are the [[Beat Freaks]], which consist of a group of professional dancers, namely Rino Nakasone, formerly of the [[Gwen Stefani]]'s [[Harajuku Girls]], and Teresa Espinosa, formerly one of [[Britney Spears]]' dancers.

== Performances == *Starting from the Final 6, when a crew gets eliminated, they take a look back at the eliminated crew's journey on the show while playing "[[Paper Trail|Slide Show]]" by [[T.I]]. === Week 1: The Sudden Death Challenge === *Aired on January 15, 2009 [[JabbaWockeeZ]]âs Rynan Paguio aka. "Kid Rainen" temporarily guest judged in place of [[JC Chasez]], with Chasez returning the following episode.{{cite web |url=http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/01/08/return-of-the-jabba-say-hello-to-abdcs-first-guest-host/ |title= Return Of The Jabba! Say Hello To ABDCâs First Guest Host}} The crews performed to a mastermix of their choosing. The bottom three were chosen by the judges and each danced in a battle for 30 seconds each to "[[Live Your Life]]" by [[T.I.]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song |- |Strikers All-Stars | "[[Swing Ya Rag]]" by [[T.I.]] featuring [[Swizz Beatz]] |- | Beat Freaks | "[[George Kranz|Din Daa Daa]]" by [[George Kranz]] |- | G.O.P. Dance | "[[Rompe]]" by [[Daddy Yankee]] |- | Quest Crew | "[[Hero (Nas song)|Hero]]" by [[Nas]] featuring [[Keri Hilson]] |- | Fly Khicks | "[[Milkshake (song)|Milkshake]]" by [[Kelis]] |- | Ringmasters | "[[The Recession|Welcome Back]]" by [[Young Jeezy]] |- | Boxcuttuhz | "[[Fancy Footwork|Bonafied Lovin']]" by [[Chromeo]] |- | Dynamic Edition | "[[My Humps]]" by [[The Black Eyed Peas]] |- | Team Millennia | "[[Decadence (album)|Beating Heart Baby]]" by [[Head Automatica]] |} *'''Safe:''' Strikers All-Stars, Beat Freaks, Quest Crew, Ringmasters, Dynamic Edition, Team Millennia *'''Bottom 3:''' G.O.P. Dance, Fly Khicks, Boxcuttuhz *'''Eliminated:''' G.O.P. Dance ===Week 2: Fit Test Challenge=== * Aired on January 22, 2009 Each crew was given a physical activity/exercise to incorporate into their routine. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song ! Challenge |- | Quest Crew | "[[Let It Rock (Kevin Rudolf song)|Let It Rock]]" by [[Kevin Rudolf]] featuring [[Lil Wayne]] | [[Kickboxing]] |- | Fly Khicks | "[[Krazy (Pitbull song)|Krazy]]" by [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]] featuring [[Lil Jon]] | Spring Back |- | Strikers All-Stars | "[[Move (If You Wanna)]] by [[Mims (rapper)|Mims]] | Monkey Roll |- | Beat Freaks | "[[Independent (Webbie song)|Independent]]" by [[Webbie]] featuring [[Lil' Boosie]] | Side Plank |- | Dynamic Edition | "[[Shake That]]" by [[Eminem]] featuring [[Nate Dogg]] | High Knees |- | Ringmasters | "[[Put On]]" by [[Young Jeezy]] featuring [[Kanye West]] | Soldier Crawl |- | Team Millennia | "[[Disturbia (song)|Disturbia]]" by [[Rihanna]] | Leap Frog |- | Boxcuttuhz | "[[Everyone Nose]]" by [[N.E.R.D.]] | Mountain Climber |} *'''Safe:''' Quest Crew, Fly Khicks, Strikers All-Stars, Beat Freaks, Dynamic Edition, Ringmasters *'''Bottom 2:''' Team Millennia, Boxcuttuhz *'''Eliminated:''' Boxcuttuhz ===Week 3: Britney Spears Challenge=== * Aired on January 29, 2009 Similar to the [[Michael Jackson]] challenge on [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 1)|season 1]] and the [[Janet Jackson]] and [[Missy Elliott]] challenges on [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 2)|season 2]], the crews took inspiration from [[Britney Spears]]'s music videos. Each group was also challenged to incorporate a feat in their routines that Britney included in the original video they were given. Andre Fuentes (Britney's long time choreographer) helped the crews with Britney's iconic moves. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song ! Challenge |- | Beat Freaks | "[[Womanizer (song)|Womanizer]]" | Perform the masculine and feminine sides of Britney from the video. |- | Strikers All-Stars | "[[Gimme More]]" | Perform while creating mirror images of themselves. |- | Dynamic Edition | "[[Stronger (Britney Spears song)|Stronger]]" | Perform while incorporating chair choreography. |- | Quest Crew | "[[Toxic (song)|Toxic]]" | Perform a portion of their routine blindfolded. |- | Fly Khicks | "[[...Baby One More Time (song)|...Baby One More Time]]" | Perform with sharp pirouettes in their routine. |- | Team Millennia | "[[Me Against The Music]]" featuring [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] | Perform with a hat and cane as props. |- | Ringmasters | "[[Circus (song)|Circus]]" | Perform an illusion making it appear as if they were giants. |} *'''Safe:''' Beat Freaks, Strikers All-Stars, Dynamic Edition, Quest Crew, Fly Khicks *'''Bottom 2:''' Team Millennia, Ringmasters *'''Eliminated:''' Team Millennia ===Week 4: Whack Track Challenge=== *Aired on February 5, 2009 A twist on the Dance Craze challenge in the [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 1)|first]] and [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 2)|second]] seasons, the crews had to perform to the most clichÃ©d dance songs that started whack dance crazes. Each crew had to incorporate their respective song's dance in their routines, while also trying to make it look fresh. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song ! Challenge |- | Quest Crew | "[[You Got It (The Right Stuff)]]" by [[New Kids on the Block]] | Perform while using the crotch grab pendulum in their routine. |- | Strikers All-Stars | "[[Too Legit to Quit (song)|2 Legit 2 Quit]]" by [[MC Hammer]] | Perform the hand [[gesture]]s and big movements from the video. |- | Beat Freaks | "[[Pretty Fly (For a White Guy)]]" by [[The Offspring]] | Perform while doing the Carlton dance. |- | Dynamic Edition | "[[Achy Breaky Heart]]" by [[Billy Ray Cyrus]] | Perform while incorporating country [[line dance|line-dancing]]. |- | Ringmasters | "[[Macarena]]" by [[Los Del Rio]] | Perform while using the Macarena dance. |- | Fly Khicks | "[[Gonna Make You Sweat (Everybody Dance Now)]]" by [[C+C Music Factory]] | Perform with the use of the running man. |} *'''Safe:''' Quest Crew, Strikers All-Stars, Beat Freaks, Dynamic Edition *'''Bottom 2:''' Ringmasters, Fly Khicks *'''Eliminated:''' Ringmasters ===Week 5: Illusion Challenge=== *Aired on February 12, 2009 The crews had to perform their routines utilizing various magic tricks and eye-popping illusions. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song ! Challenge |- | Beat Freaks | "[[Freeze (song)|Freeze]]" by [[T-Pain]] featuring [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] | Perform while making something levitate. |- | Quest Crew | "[[Got Money]]" by [[Lil Wayne]] featuring [[T-Pain]] | Perform while passing an object through their bodies. |- | Strikers All-Stars | "[[Swing (Savage song)|Swing]]" by [[Savage (rapper)|Savage]] | Perform while walking through a solid object. |- | Dynamic Edition | "[[The Fame (Lady GaGa album)|Starstruck]]" by [[Lady Gaga]] featuring [[Flo Rida]] | Perform while trying to appear out of thin air. |- | Fly Khicks | "[[Diva (Beyonce song)|Diva]]" by [[Beyonce]] | Perform while stretching like rubber. |} *'''Safe:''' Beat Freaks, Quest Crew, Strikers All-Stars *'''Bottom 2:''' Dynamic Edition, Fly Khicks *'''Eliminated:''' Dynamic Edition ===Week 6: Battle of the Sexes Challenge=== *Aired on February 19, 2009 The episode started off with the remaining crews doing an intro performance together choreographed by [[Napoleon D'umo|Napoleon]] and [[Tabitha D'umo]]. The four crews battled it out in the Girls vs Boys style. Similar to the Video Star Challenge in the [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 1)|first]] and [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 2)|second]] seasons, each crew was given a video by a male or female superstar that emulated either 'girl power' or 'guy power', and were challenged to incorporate the spirit of the video in their choreography. This was the first time in [[America's Best Dance Crew|ABDC]] history that the top 4 consisted of two all male crews, and two all female crews. The male groups [[Quest Crew]] and Strikers All-Stars danced to [[Ludacris]]' [[What Them Girls Like]], while the female groups [[Beat Freaks]] and Fly Khicks danced to [[Beyonce]]'s [[Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)|Single Ladies]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song ! Challenge |- | Quest Crew | "[[Forever (Chris Brown song)|Forever]]" by [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] | Incorporate smooth moves and gliding in their performance. |- | Beat Freaks | "[[Hot n Cold]]" by [[Katy Perry]] | Incorporate the Louisville Slugger within the routine. |- | Strikers All-Stars | "[[Pose (Daddy Yankee song)|Pose]]" by [[Daddy Yankee]] | Incorporate their best swagger as well as attempt the uprocking and the groove. |- | Fly Khicks | "[[Pon De Replay]]" by [[Rihanna]] | Perform using many different styles, including belly dance and island dancehall. |} *'''Safe:''' Quest Crew, Beat Freaks *'''Bottom 2:''' Strikers All-Stars, Fly Khicks *'''Eliminated:''' Strikers All-Stars ===Week 7: Hip Hop Decathlon and Last Chance Challenge=== *Aired on February 26, 2009 This week on ABDC, the crews competed against each other in two challenges: the Hip-Hop Decathlon and the Last Chance Challenge. After the mid-show elimination, then the top two crews performed to their Last Chance Challenge. ====Challenge #1: Hip-Hop Decathlon==== The three remaining crews had to demonstrate their versatility by creating a routine that incorporated five different hip-hop dance styles. Although the crews performed only five styles, MTV chose to refer to the challenge as a decathlon. All crews were given the same five styles and songs, and they received help from five guest ABDC alumni from the previous two seasons. Each alumnus/alumna was assigned to one of the dance styles the crews will be responsible for. The setting in the video that the crews were supposed to watch to learn the styles was in [[Rob Dyrdek's Fantasy Factory]]. {| class="wikitable" style=white-space:nowrap; text-align:center; table-layout: fixed;" ! Song ! Style ! Guest |- | "[[Poker Face (Lady Gaga song)|Poker Face]]" by [[Lady Gaga]] | [[List of breakdance moves#Other Moves|Threading]] | Ronnie "Ronnie Boy" Abaldonado of [[Super Cr3w]] |- | "[[I'm in Miami, Bitch|I'm in Miami (LA), Trick]]" by [[LMFAO (group)|LMFAO]]" | [[Waving (dance)|Waving]] | Kevin "KB" Brewer of [[JabbaWockeeZ]] |- | "[[Love Lockdown]]" by [[Kanye West]] | [[Tutting]] | Mike Song of [[Kaba Modern]] |- | "[[Closer (Ne-Yo song)|Closer]]" by [[Ne-Yo]] | [[House dance|Housing]] | Taeko Carroll of Fysh N Chicks |- | "[[Get Up (50 Cent song)|Get Up]]" by [[50 Cent]] | [[Krumping]] | Antoine "Frost" Troupe of [[Supreme Soul]] |} *'''Safe:''' Beat Freaks *'''Bottom 2:''' Quest Crew, Fly Khicks *'''Eliminated:''' Fly Khicks ====Challenge #2: Last Chance Challenge==== The crews created original beats to groove to during their routine for the Last Chance Challenge to show America why ''they'' should be crowned the winner. The remaining two crews then performed their prepared routines before the lines open for the final voting session of the season. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Performance Title |- | Beat Freaks | Freak the Dream |- | Quest Crew | OrQUESTra |} ===Week 8: The Live Finale=== *Aired on March 5, 2009 The eliminated crews of season 3 returned and teamed up with the remaining two crews for the judge's choice of crews collaboration. The judges each picked three crews that complemented each other and their dance-styles. Instead of going head-to-head, [[Quest Crew]] and [[Beat Freaks]] teamed up for their last performance. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crews ! Song |- | '''[[Shane Sparks]]:''' Quest Crew, Strikers All-Stars, and Dynamic Edition | "[[Right Round]]" by [[Flo Rida]] |- | '''[[JC Chasez]]:''' Beat Freaks, Team Millennia and Boxcuttuhz | "[[Just Dance (song)|Just Dance]]" by [[Lady Gaga]] |- | '''[[Lil Mama]]:''' Fly Khicks, Ringmasters, and G.O.P Dance | "[[The Tide Is High|Numba 1 (Tide Is High)]]" by [[Kardinal Offishall]] featuring [[Keri Hilson]] |- | Quest Crew and Beat Freaks | "[[Beggin']]" by [[Madcon]] |- | Quest Crew | "[[Paper Trail|On Top of The World]]'" by [[T.I.]] featuring [[Ludacris]] |} On March 5, 2009 [[Quest Crew]] was crowned the winner of '''America's Best Dance Crew Season 3''', while [[Beat Freaks]] was declared the runner-up. *'''Winner:''' Quest Crew *'''Runner-up:''' Beat Freaks == References == {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]''|before=[[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 2)|Season 2]]|after=[[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 4)|Season 4]]|years='''''Season 3'''''}} {{s-end}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.mtv.com/ontv/dyn/dance_crew/series.jhtml}} {{America's Best Dance Crew}} [[Category:2009 television seasons]] [[Category:Dance competitions]] [[no:America's Best Dance Crew (sesong 3)]]
